ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Very thorough analysis and application of species counterpoint, harmonic function, parallel period and sentence structure, sequences, applied chords relating to tonicization and modulation, musical texture, and 18th-Century composition rules and tendencies.
I learned new rules regarding music composition.

Reinforcement of roman numeral concepts, basic counterpoint, voice leading skills, use of different phrase structures like sentences and periods, new insights on analyzing/writing harmonies, and various labeling techniques for analysis of phrase structure, sequences, etc

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought that this was a well rounded course with great content, but at the very end when we got to the minuet form and quartet style, it got kind of repetitive. So I would maybe recommend adding one more topic to the course.
Very effective in teaching the aforementioned theory concepts, with subsequent application in class and in the following homework assignments.
The overall course was well-organized, though lesson-by-lesson, it felt somewhat less well-organized.

The course covers a good amount of material and is appropriately challenging; there could be more review in the beginning for students who place into the class but might not have a comprehensive knowledge of all things covered in 110

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would totally recommend this course to anyone who is interested in music theory and the applications of those guidelines to classical music. We analysed works from Haydn, Mozart, and Beethoven and got to even write our own music!
Absolutely recommended to anyone interested in expanding their knowledge of music or ever pursuing music, even informally, in the future. This course will better you as any kind of musician.

I definitely recommend this course to anybody who has a firm footing in the basics of music theory and would like to expand their knowledge. My background in music theory before this course was AP Music Theory in high school, and this course was a rather significant jump in complexity for me.
I'd recommend it if you have an interest in learning more musical theory/strengthening your music writing skills. The class is pretty chill without a huge workload, and teaches you a lot.
